name: Meal Prep AI - Fitness-Focused Recipe Platform
description: A web application that generates meal prep plans based on available ingredients, optimized for fitness goals (weight loss, maintenance, muscle gain). Users input fridge contents and receive recipe suggestions with nutrition info, fridge life tracking, and shopping lists.

tasks.title: Initialize Next.js 14 project with TypeScript
tasks.description: Create new Next.js project using App Router, configure TypeScript, ESLint, and Prettier. Set up project structure with /app, /components, /lib, /types directories.

tasks.title: Install and configure Tailwind CSS
tasks.description: Set up Tailwind CSS with custom theme colors for fitness branding. Configure responsive breakpoints and custom utilities.
acceptance_criteria: Tailwind CSS working with hot reload
Custom color palette defined (primary, secondary, success, warning)

tasks.title: Set up Supabase project and local configuration
tasks.description: Create Supabase project, generate API keys, configure environment variables, install Supabase client libraries.

tasks.title: Design and create database schema
tasks.description: Create SQL schema for users, ingredients, user_ingredients, user_favorites, usage_tracking tables. Set up RLS policies.
acceptance_criteria: Tables created: users, ingredients (500 items), user_ingredients, user_favorites, usage_tracking

tasks.title: Seed ingredients database with 500 fitness-focused items
tasks.description: Create seed data for 500 common ingredients with categories (proteins, vegetables, grains, spices, etc.), average prices, and standard measurements. Focus on fitness-friendly whole foods.
acceptance_criteria: 500 ingredients seeded with: name, category, avg_price, unit, calories_per_100g
Categories: lean proteins (chicken, fish, turkey), vegetables, fruits, whole grains, healthy fats, spices
CSV or JSON seed file created
Seed script executable via npm command

tasks.title: Set up Supabase Auth with email authentication
tasks.description: Configure Supabase Auth for email/password authentication. Create auth context provider and hooks.
acceptance_criteria: useAuth() hook for accessing auth state

tasks.title: Create authentication pages (login, signup, reset password)
tasks.description: Build responsive auth pages with form validation. Include error handling and loading states.
acceptance_criteria: Form validation using react-hook-form or similar
Loading states and error messages displayed

tasks.title: Create protected route middleware
tasks.description: Implement Next.js middleware to protect authenticated routes and check subscription tier.
acceptance_criteria: Checks user tier (free/paid) for feature access

tasks.title: Create main dashboard layout and navigation
tasks.description: Build responsive dashboard with sidebar navigation, header with user menu, and main content area. Mobile-first design.

tasks.title: Build ingredient autocomplete input component
tasks.description: Create searchable autocomplete input that queries the 500-ingredient database. Support adding multiple ingredients with quantities.
acceptance_criteria: Dropdown shows matching ingredients as user types
Can select ingredient and specify quantity/unit
Selected ingredients displayed as removable chips/tags

tasks.title: Create 'My Fridge' page with ingredient management
tasks.description: Build the main page where users input and manage their available ingredients. Include save/load functionality.
acceptance_criteria: Users can add ingredients with quantities
Visual grouping by category (proteins, veggies, etc.)

tasks.title: Design and implement goal selection component
tasks.description: Create UI for users to select their fitness goal: Lose Weight, Maintain, or Gain Muscle. Save preference to user profile.
acceptance_criteria: GoalSelector component with 3 options (radio buttons or cards)
Goal saved to users table (goal_type column)
Can change goal at any time

tasks.title: Create recipe card component (simple mode)
tasks.description: Design reusable recipe card component showing: recipe name, cooking time, servings, fridge life indicator, and ingredient match percentage.
acceptance_criteria: Shows: title, cook time, servings, fridge life badge
Color-coded fridge life (green 4+ days, yellow 2-3 days, red same day)

tasks.title: Build recipe detail modal/page (simple mode)
tasks.description: Create detailed view for a single recipe with ingredients list, instructions, and cooking time. Simple mode only (no nutrition info yet).
acceptance_criteria: Displays: full ingredient list with quantities, step-by-step instructions
Shows which ingredients user has vs needs to buy

tasks.title: Set up Claude API integration
tasks.description: Install Anthropic SDK, configure API key, create utility functions for Claude API calls with error handling and rate limiting.
acceptance_criteria: Utility function in /lib/claude.ts for API calls

tasks.title: Design and test recipe generation prompt
tasks.description: Create optimized Claude prompt template for generating fitness-focused recipes. Test with various ingredient combinations and goals. Focus on high-protein, balanced macros.
acceptance_criteria: Prompt template accepts: ingredient list, goal (lose/maintain/gain), cuisine preferences
Returns JSON with: recipe name, ingredients, instructions, prep/cook time, servings, calories, macros, fridge life
Fitness-optimized recipes (high protein, quality carbs, healthy fats)

tasks.title: Create recipe generation API endpoint
tasks.description: Build /api/recipes/generate endpoint that takes user ingredients and goal, calls Claude API, returns 3 makeable recipes + 1 'almost there' recipe.
acceptance_criteria: Returns: 3 recipes with 100% ingredient match, 1 recipe with 70-95% match

tasks.title: Implement rate limiting for free vs paid tiers
tasks.description: Create middleware to enforce generation limits: 1/day for free users, 10/day for paid users. Track usage in database.
acceptance_criteria: Free tier: max 1 generation/day (resets midnight UTC)
tasks.notes: Requires testing to confirm full implementation

tasks.title: Build 'Generate Meal Plan' page with results display
tasks.description: Create main page where users click 'Generate' and see their 3+1 recipes. Show loading state during generation (~10-15 sec).
acceptance_criteria: Big 'Generate Meal Plan' button (disabled if no ingredients)
Displays 3 recipe cards (100% match) in primary section
Displays 1 'almost there' recipe in separate section with shopping list preview

tasks.title: Implement 'almost there' recipe logic with shopping suggestions
tasks.description: Algorithm to find recipes missing 1-3 ingredients, calculate cost of missing items, display shopping suggestion.
acceptance_criteria: Identifies recipes where user has 70-95% of ingredients
Shows missing ingredients list with quantities
Calculates estimated cost from ingredients database
Displays: 'Buy these 2 items for $5.50 to make this recipe'

tasks.title: Add fridge life calculation and display
tasks.description: Create database or JSON file with fridge life data for recipe types. Display color-coded badges on recipe cards.
acceptance_criteria: Fridge life data for common recipe types (chicken dishes: 3-4 days, fish: 2 days, beef stew: 4-5 days, etc.)
Logic to determine fridge life based on primary protein/ingredients
Color-coded badges: 🟢 4+ days, 🟡 2-3 days, 🔴 same day, ❄️ freezer friendly
Tooltip with storage tips (e.g., 'Store in airtight container')
tasks.notes: Requires testing to confirm full implementation

tasks.title: Set up Stripe integration for subscriptions
tasks.description: Install Stripe SDK, create products/prices in Stripe dashboard, implement checkout flow.
acceptance_criteria: Product created in Stripe: 'Meal Prep Pro' at $7.99/month
Test mode working with test cards

tasks.title: Create subscription management API endpoints
tasks.description: Build API routes for creating checkout sessions, handling webhooks, and managing subscription status.
acceptance_criteria: Updates user.subscription_tier in database on successful payment

tasks.title: Build upgrade/pricing page
tasks.description: Create marketing page showing free vs paid tier comparison, benefits, and upgrade CTA button.
acceptance_criteria: Highlights: 10 gens/day, 8 recipes, detailed mode, nutrition, shopping lists
'Upgrade to Pro' button redirects to Stripe checkout
Current subscription status displayed if already paid

tasks.title: Implement detailed mode toggle with nutrition info
tasks.description: Add toggle in UI to switch between simple/detailed mode. Detailed mode shows calories, macros, cost estimate, prep/cook time breakdown. PAID ONLY.
acceptance_criteria: Toggle switch in recipe card (only shows if user is paid tier)
Detailed mode displays: calories, protein/carbs/fats, estimated cost, prep vs cook time
Free users see 'Upgrade to Pro' badge on toggle
User preference saved (local storage or database)

tasks.title: Build shopping list generator (paid feature)
tasks.description: Aggregate all missing ingredients across selected recipes into one consolidated shopping list with total cost estimate.
acceptance_criteria: ShoppingList component accessible from meal plan results
Combines missing ingredients from 'almost there' recipes

tasks.title: Create favorites system (paid feature)
tasks.description: Allow paid users to save/favorite recipes for quick access later. Build favorites library page.
acceptance_criteria: Heart/star icon on recipe cards to save favorites
Saves full recipe JSON to user_favorites table
Search/filter favorites by cuisine, protein type, etc.

tasks.title: Add dietary filters and cuisine preferences (paid)
tasks.description: Create filter UI for dietary restrictions (vegetarian, vegan, gluten-free, dairy-free) and cuisine types. Integrate with recipe generation prompt.
acceptance_criteria: Filter panel in 'Generate Meal Plan' page
Dietary filters: vegetarian, vegan, gluten-free, dairy-free (multi-select)
Cuisine preferences: Italian, Asian, Mexican, Mediterranean, American (multi-select)
Filters passed to Claude prompt to adjust recipe generation

tasks.title: Implement basic budgeting display (paid feature)
tasks.description: Show cost breakdown: per recipe, per serving, and weekly total. Display in detailed mode and meal plan summary.
acceptance_criteria: Each recipe shows: total cost, cost per serving
Meal plan summary shows: total weekly cost, average cost per meal
Based on avg_price from ingredients database
Cost breakdown visible in detailed mode
Weekly summary card at bottom of meal plan results

tasks.title: Implement comprehensive error handling and loading states
tasks.description: Add error boundaries, graceful error messages, loading skeletons, and fallback UI throughout the app.
acceptance_criteria: Error boundary component wraps main app
Loading skeletons for recipe cards during generation
Retry buttons for failed API calls

tasks.title: Add analytics and usage tracking
tasks.description: Integrate analytics (Vercel Analytics or Posthog) to track: page views, generation clicks, conversion to paid, feature usage.
acceptance_criteria: User cohort tracking (free vs paid behavior)

tasks.title: Optimize Claude API costs and caching
tasks.description: Implement caching strategy for common ingredient combinations. Cache popular recipes to reduce API calls.
acceptance_criteria: Redis or Vercel KV for caching (if budget allows)
Cache key based on: ingredient_ids + goal + filters
Hit rate monitoring (target: 20%+ cache hits after 1 month)
Fallback to API if cache miss

tasks.title: Mobile responsiveness audit and fixes
tasks.description: Test all pages on mobile devices (iOS/Android), fix layout issues, ensure touch targets are appropriate size.
acceptance_criteria: All pages responsive down to 375px width (iPhone SE)
Forms are easy to use on mobile keyboards
Tested on real devices (iOS Safari, Android Chrome)

tasks.title: Create onboarding flow for new users
tasks.description: Build guided onboarding: welcome message, quick ingredient input tutorial, generate first meal plan. Increase activation rate.
acceptance_criteria: 3-step onboarding: (1) Add ingredients, (2) Select goal, (3) Generate first plan
Success metrics: % of users who complete onboarding

tasks.title: Add email notifications for key events
tasks.description: Set up transactional emails: welcome email, subscription confirmation, generation limit reset reminder.
acceptance_criteria: Welcome email on signup with getting started guide
Daily reminder at 11am if user hasn't used their free generation

tasks.title: Performance optimization and SEO
tasks.description: Optimize images, implement lazy loading, add meta tags for SEO, improve Lighthouse scores.
acceptance_criteria: Next.js Image component used for all images
Lazy loading for recipe cards and images
Meta tags for all pages (title, description, OG tags)

tasks.title: Write unit tests for critical functions
tasks.description: Add tests for: ingredient search, recipe generation logic, rate limiting, subscription status checks.
acceptance_criteria: Jest and React Testing Library configured
Tests for: /api/recipes/generate, rate limiting logic, subscription tier checks
CI/CD integration (GitHub Actions runs tests on push)

tasks.title: Deploy to Vercel production environment
tasks.description: Set up production environment on Vercel, configure environment variables, custom domain, SSL certificate.

tasks.title: Recruit and onboard 10-20 beta testers
tasks.description: Invite beta testers, provide them with test accounts (some free, some paid), create feedback collection system.
acceptance_criteria: 10-20 beta testers recruited (mix of free and paid tier)
Feedback form created (Google Form or Typeform)

tasks.title: Monitor beta usage and collect feedback
tasks.description: Track beta tester activity, identify bugs, collect qualitative feedback on UX, recipe quality, and features.
acceptance_criteria: Daily check-in on analytics (generation rate, errors, conversion)

tasks.title: Fix critical bugs identified in beta
tasks.description: Address P0 and P1 bugs found during beta testing. Focus on blockers and major UX issues.
acceptance_criteria: No known data loss or security issues

tasks.title: Implement key UX improvements from feedback
tasks.description: Based on beta feedback, make high-impact UX improvements (e.g., simplify ingredient input, improve recipe readability).
acceptance_criteria: Changes based on recurring feedback themes

tasks.title: Create FAQ and help documentation
tasks.description: Write help docs for common questions: How to add ingredients? How does meal planning work? How to cancel subscription?
acceptance_criteria: Cover: account setup, ingredient input, recipe generation, subscription, troubleshooting
Link to help in footer and user menu

tasks.title: Create landing page for public marketing
tasks.description: Build compelling landing page at root (/) with: hero section, features, pricing, testimonials (if available), CTA to sign up.
acceptance_criteria: Hero section with value prop: 'Stop wasting food. Start meal prepping smarter.'
Features section highlighting: AI-powered recipes, nutrition tracking, budget savings

tasks.title: Set up customer support system
tasks.description: Configure support email, create auto-response, set up ticketing system (e.g., Help Scout, Zendesk, or simple email).

tasks.title: Create launch announcement content
tasks.description: Write launch announcement for social media, email newsletter, Product Hunt (if applicable), and blog post.
acceptance_criteria: Social media posts drafted (Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram)
Product Hunt submission prepared (title, tagline, description, images)
Blog post: 'Introducing Meal Prep AI' with screenshots and demo video
Press kit with logo, screenshots, founder quote

tasks.title: Set up monitoring and alerting
tasks.description: Configure uptime monitoring, error tracking (Sentry), and alerts for critical issues (payment failures, API errors).
acceptance_criteria: Uptime monitoring (UptimeRobot or similar) pinging every 5 min
Slack/email alerts for: site down, API error rate >5%, payment webhook failures
Dashboard for key metrics: uptime, error rate, API costs
Daily digest email with key stats

tasks.title: Final pre-launch checklist and QA
tasks.description: Complete end-to-end testing of all user flows: signup, generate recipes, upgrade to paid, cancel subscription. Check all edge cases.
acceptance_criteria: Test all user flows on production environment
Verify: signup, login, password reset, ingredient input, recipe generation, upgrade, payment, cancellation
Test on multiple browsers (Chrome, Safari, Firefox)
All environment variables confirmed in production

tasks.title: Launch and monitor for first 48 hours
tasks.description: Publicly announce launch, monitor for issues, respond to user feedback quickly, be ready to deploy hotfixes.
acceptance_criteria: Launch announcement posted on all channels
Monitor analytics in real-time for first 48 hours
Respond to support requests within 2 hours
Track key metrics: signups, generations, upgrades, churn
